definitions: Past tense and past participle of spin.
To turn or cause to turn rapidly.
To draw out and twist fibers into thread or yarn.
To create a web or cocoon.
To present information with a particular bias or interpretation.
examples: The dancer spun across the stage.
She spun the yarn into a beautiful sweater.
The spider spun a intricate web.
The politician spun the story to his advantage.
